question: Ice cubes are floating in a glass of water. What will happen to the water level when the ice cubes melt?
option1: Will first increase and then start decreasing
option2: Will first decrease and then start increasing
explanation: The water level remains the same when the ice cube melts. A floating object displaces an amount of water equal to its own weight. Since water expands when it freezes, one ounce of frozen water has a larger volume than one ounce of liquid water.
